intro: Triuris major, commonly known as the giant triuris, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 15 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, and it thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
